labels.analysis: The MCP Server is primarily focused on calendar management through integration with Cal.com. It allows users to add, update, delete, and list appointments within their Cal.com calendar. This functionality centers around scheduling, appointment management, and time coordination, making it a specialized tool for time and calendar-related operations.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality of this server is directly related to calendar and scheduling operations, which aligns with the "Time & Calendar" predefined category. There is no need for custom labels since the server's purpose is well-covered by existing categories.
labels.custom_label: No secondary labels are needed as this server's functionality is very clearly contained within a single category

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Cal.com Calendar Integration
server_info_crawled.author: @mumunha/cal_dot_com_mcpserver
server_info_crawled.overview: Schedule, update, and manage your calendar appointments seamlessly. Enhance your scheduling capabilities by integrating with the Cal.com Calendar API for efficient appointment management.

tools.name: calcom_add_appointment
tools.description: Deploy Server Cal.com Calendar Integration Claim Server @mumunha/cal_dot_com_mcpserver Try in Playground calcom_add_appointment

tools.name: calcom_update_appointment
tools.description: Updates an existing appointment in Cal.com calendar. Use this for rescheduling or modifying existing appointments. Requires booking ID and the fields to update.

tools.name: calcom_delete_appointment
tools.description: Deletes an existing appointment from Cal.com calendar. Use this for canceling appointments. Requires booking ID.

tools.name: calcom_list_appointments
tools.description: Lists appointments from Cal.com calendar. Can be filtered by date range. Returns a list of appointments with their details.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@mumunha/cal_dot_com_mcpserver/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: calcomApiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: The API key for the Cal.com Calendar API.
